It is a place different from main Paraguay on one hand due to the remote location and harsh environment, on the other hand there is a majority of people of German origin that came by the way of Canada. The first people arrived in the 1920s and the town was finally founded in 1927. Their economic basis is agriculture in particular cattle farming. They still speak German (Plattdeutsch) but Spanish as readily. The

is responsible for many aspects of life in the colony.

Most businesses are closed during lunchtime from 12:00 to 14:00, as well as on Saturday afternoon and Sunday.

The town is of a size that is manageable by foot. If you are lucky you might come across a taxi. Local public transport is non-existent.

The main road is called Avenida Central and most of the things relevant for the tourist are on this street between the two roundabouts or close-by.
